isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - FRONT DRIVE AXLE: SPICER S-9000 - DIFFERENTIAL INSTALLATION

svcproc.title: DIFFERENTIAL INSTALLATION
svcproc.para: Use Figure 3 as a reference to install the differential.

step1.para: Assemble oil pickup cup onto differential case as shown ( Figure 46).
Install ring gear and differential assembly into carrier housing. Tilt differential slightly so ring gear clears straddle bearing support ( Figure 47).

figure.caption: Figure 47. Install Ring Gear and Differential Assembly

caution.para: Care should be used when installing ring gear and differential into carrier housing so damage to ring gear, pinion, bearings, or bearing bores does not occur.

step1.para: Be sure bearing cups are seated on bearing cones and assemble differential bearing caps. Install bearing cap bolts ( finger tight only). Install adjusting rings.
Tighten adjusting ring on back side of ring gear until there is zero (0) backlash between ring gear and pinion.

Next tighten adjusting ring on tooth side of ring gear until bearing cup is seated ( Figure 48). Continue to tighten adjusting ring until gear backlash is set to specification etched on edge of ring gear ( Figure 2).
Check ring gear and pinion backlash in four equally spaced positions around the ring gear with dial indicator as shown ( Figure 49).

figure.caption: Figure 49. Check Ring Gear and Pinion Backlash

note.para: If the backlash tolerance does not vary more than .022 in. (.050 mm), the setting is acceptable.

step1.para: Once backlash is set, tighten the differential bearing cap bolts to 115 to 125 ft-lbs. (156 to 169 Nm) ( Figure 50).

figure.caption: Figure 50. Tighten Differential Bearing Cap Bolts
